result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio J Maholmes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio J Maholmes

records.addlTxt: of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on August 15, 2022

1:59 PM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio J Maholmes in court, in custody with Attorney Carly June Sebion. 

Agreement has been reached. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. State files Information that mirrors the criminal complaint. Defendant makes statement to the court. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Possession of Methamphetamine. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders 1 year initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision. Concurrent to any other sentence.
Conditions of extended supervision:
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Court costs, provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 


Court finds Defendant eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program.

159 days jail credit.

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 11:01 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Antonio Maholmes appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Complaint. Defendant updates address and phone number. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
State requests $1,000 cash bond. Defense requests signature bond- Defendant on Probation hold. Court orders $5,000 signature bond with various conditions. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 03/09/2022 at 2:30 PM.  Hearing: 04/05/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with C.Q., T.W., their employment, or their residences.

Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia.
